data.title: Nomura Adjusts LIC Housing Finance's Price Target to INR735 From INR700, Keeps at Buy
data.description: LIC Housing Finance has an average rating of outperform and price targets ranging from 470 Indian rupees to 940 rupees, according to analysts polled by Capital IQ.

data.title: Asia Markets Give Up Earlier Gains — WSJ
data.description:
By Kimberley Kao

Markets across Asia began the day with a relief rally after the U.S. struck last-minute deals with Mexico and Canada to delay tariffs, but the mood took a turn when China hit back with new levies on the U.S.

The news poured cold water on hopes that there would be talks between Washington and Beijing that would also postpone the 10% tariffs on all Chinese goods entering the U.S.

The offshore yuan weakened against the dollar, while benchmark indexes in Hong Kong, Japan and South Korea pared gains.

Oil futures extended losses, with front-month WTI crude oil futures down 1.8% to $71.83 per barrel, and Brent down 1.2% to $75.07 per barrel.

Bitcoin tumbled, falling below $100,000. Spot gold was broadly steady, sitting 0.1% lower at $2,811.23 per ounce.

The "overarching geo-economic dimensions to U.S.-China trade means that resolution will be far more fraught than is the case with Mexico and Canada," Vishnu Varathan of Mizuho Securities said in a note.

This item is part of a Wall Street Journal live coverage event. The full stream can be found by searching P/WSJL (WSJ Live Coverage).

data.title: Accumulate Sun Pharmaceutical Industries; target of Rs 1967: KR Choksey
data.description:
KR Choksey's research report on Sun Pharmaceutical Industries

Sun Pharma’s revenue was largely in-line with our estimates. However, EBITDA beat our estimates (+4.7%) due to lower-than-expected operating expenses and Adj. PAT beat our estimates due to better operating performance and better than expected other income. We increase our FY26E/FY27E EPS estimates by 0.4% and 4.4% to INR 58.1 and INR 66.9 respectively, as we believe specialty products like Odomzo and Ilumya will continue to grow in EM and ROW markets, with new product launches the company reinforce its leadership position in branded generics in India.

Outlook

We roll over our valuation multiple to FY27E and assign a PE multiple of 29.4x to arrive at a target price of INR 1,967 (unchanged) and maintain our “ACCUMULATE” rating on the stock.

data.title: UBS Results Benefit From Cost Management — Market Talk
data.description: UBS Group's fourth-quarter results were better than expected and benefited from good cost management, Vontobel's Andreas Venditti says in a research note. The Swiss banking group posted an underlying pretax profit of $1.77 billion for the fourth quarter, or 24% ahead of consensus forecasts thanks to lower expenses than expected, the analysts say. Its dividend was also higher than anticipated and came alongside plans to buy back up to $3 billion in shares this year, in line with expectations, Vontobel says. UBS remains on track to substantially complete the integration of Credit Suisse by the end of next year, even if expenses are now expected to be slightly higher than previously targeted, the analyst says. (adria.calatayud@wsj.com)

data.title: Novartis Target Raised to CHF110.00 From CHF100.00 by Deutsche Bank
Novartis Raised to Buy by Deutsche Bank
Infineon Lifts Sales Guidance After Boost From AI Chips — Update
data.description:
By Mauro Orru

Infineon Technologies raised its sales forecasts for the fiscal year amid solid demand for chips to power servers and data centers behind the artificial-intelligence boom.

The German chip maker said revenue would be flat to slightly up in the year to the end of September from the 14.96 billion euros ($15.94 billion) it reported for fiscal 2024. Infineon had previously forecast a slight decline. Meanwhile, Infineon's segment result margin--a key profitability measure--is still expected in the mid-to-high-teens percentage range.

The upgrade comes after what Infineon said was a slightly better start to the fiscal year than expected amid a boost in semiconductors sales for servers and data centers to power AI. However, areas of the semiconductor industry outside of artificial intelligence continue to suffer from sluggish demand.

Orders for legacy chips found in cars and industrial equipment has been subdued in recent months as car makers and manufacturers of industrial machinery cut spending since they stockpiled the semiconductors they needed years ago.

The divergence in demand between AI chips and legacy semiconductors meant that chip makers with significant AI exposure like Nvidia have grown exponentially, while companies such as Infineon that mostly sell chips to the automotive sector and makers of industrial equipment have struggled.

Infineon slashed its sales guidance three times in the previous fiscal year. Last week, Tesla supplier STMicroelectronics said it was expecting lower sales this quarter, citing challenges in demand for legacy semiconductors.

"Following the expected inventory reduction, we continue to anticipate that the recovery in demand will be gradual for the current fiscal year," Infineon Chief Executive Jochen Hanebeck said.

The company posted 3.42 billion euros in sales in the three months to the end of December, down 8% on year. Infineon's automotive division--which accounts for the lion's share of revenue--logged a 8% contraction in sales. Only the power and sensor systems business reported an increase in sales, lifted by chips for servers and data centers.

Net profit declined to 246 million euros from 587 million euros, while Infineon's segment result contracted to 573 million euros from 831 million euros, generating a 16.7% margin.

Analysts had forecast quarterly sales of nearly 3.23 billion euros, a net profit of 252 million euros, a segment result of 477 million euros and a 14.8% margin, according to a Vara Research consensus.

For the current quarter, Infineon is expecting sales of around 3.6 billion euros and a segment result margin in the mid-teens percentage range.

Write to Mauro Orru at mauro.orru@wsj.com

data.title: Deutsche Bank Had Novartis at Hold
Gold Holds Steady Near Record High
data.description:
Gold steadied around $2,810 per ounce on Tuesday, but remained near an all-time high reached in the previous session as tariff jitters prompted safe-haven spending.

China announced retaliatory tariffs on U.S. goods after President Donald Trump’s 10% levy on Chinese imports came into effect.

Meanwhile, Trump late Monday agreed to delay duties on Mexico and Canada for a month after the leaders of both countries took steps to appease his concerns about border security and drug trafficking.

The inflationary impact of tariffs could further bolster gold’s appeal as a hedge against price pressures and geopolitical uncertainty.

However, this may also lead to higher interest rates, posing a challenge for non-yielding bullion.

Meanwhile, investors are keenly anticipating labor data this week, particularly Friday’s nonfarm payrolls report, which could offer more insights into the strength of the U.S. economy.

data.title: Nintendo Cuts Earnings, Switch Sales Guidance
data.description:
By Kosaku Narioka

Nintendo cut its annual projections for earnings and Switch console sales after weak results for the nine months ended December.

The Japanese videogame maker said Tuesday that net profit dropped 42% from a year earlier to 237.19 billion yen, equivalent to $1.53 billion, for the nine-month period. Revenue fell 31% to Y956.22 billion.

The Switch console, launched in 2017, was a runaway success for Nintendo, which has had a spotty record with hardware, but sales of the aging console are now firmly in decline.

Nintendo said in January that it would start selling the successor to its nearly eight-year-old console this year, but didn't reveal the price, the launch date nor specifications.

The company now expects to sell 11.0 million Switch consoles for the year ending March, down from 12.5 million units forecast previously, and 150 million software copies, lower than its previous view of 160 million copies.

Nintendo projected net profit to drop 45% to Y270.00 billion and revenue to decline 29% to Y1.190 trillion this fiscal year.

The videogame maker has been diversifying its revenue streams with some success, offering other forms of entertainment by leveraging its popular characters and game series.

Write to Kosaku Narioka at kosaku.narioka@wsj.com

data.title: Nobia AB 4Q Sales SEK2.51B
Nobia AB 4Q Net Loss SEK856M
AMD Reports Earnings Today. The Outlook Is a Worry. — Barrons.com
data.description:
By Tae Kim

The outlook for revenue will be investors' focus when Advanced Micro Devices reports its fourth-quarter earnings after the close Tuesday.

The consensus forecast among analysts is that AMD will report December quarter revenue of $7.5 billion with adjusted earnings per share of $1.08. For the current quarter, the consensus call is that revenue will be $7.0 billion and earnings per share will come in at 95 cents, according to FactSet.

On Friday, Keybanc analyst John Vinh reaffirmed an Overweight rating and $150 price target for AMD. The analyst warned, however, the company's near-term outlook may not impress shareholders.

"We expect AMD to post in line to higher results and lower guidance," he wrote. "We see NT [near term] risk to forward guidance."

The analyst cited softer laptop shipments and the potential for weaker demand for server processors for the potentially weak guidance.

Last week, Intel, AMD's main chip rival, gave a softer-than-expected outlook for its March quarter, citing a weakening global economy. It said some buying that might have happened in the current quarter moved forward to the December quarter as investors sought to prepare for potential tariffs under the Trump administration.

AMD shares are down 36% over the past 12 months, compared to the 8% gain for the iShares Semiconductor ETF.

Write to Tae Kim at tae.kim@barrons.com

This content was created by Barron's, which is operated by Dow Jones & Co. Barron's is published independently from Dow Jones Newswires and The Wall Street Journal.

data.title: Diageo Reports Lower Fiscal H1 Profit, Net Sales
data.description:
Diageo reported Tuesday that its profit and net sales decreased year over year in the first half of fiscal 2025.

Profit attributable to equity shareholders of the parent company for the six months ended Dec. 31, 2024, was $1.94 billion, compared with $2.21 billion earlier. EPS moved to $0.869 from $0.984.

The British alcoholic beverage company's net sales were $10.90 billion, compared with $10.96 billion a year ago.

Meanwhile, the board declared an unchanged interim dividend of $0.4050 per share for the period, payable on April 24 to shareholders on record Feb. 28.

The company withdrew its previous guidance of a sequential improvement in organic sales for the second half of fiscal 2025, as well as its medium-term guidance for organic net sales in the 5% to 7% range.

data.title: Vodafone Group Fiscal Q3 Revenue Climbs
data.description:
Vodafone said Tuesday its total revenue for the three months ended Dec. 31, 2024, increased year over year.

The British telecommunications company's revenue was 9.81 billion euros, compared with 9.35 billion euros previously.

data.title: Barclays Lifts Novartis' Price Target on Strong FY25 Guidance
data.description:
Barclays raised its price target on Novartis to 90 francs from 85 francs after the Swiss drugmaker provided stronger-than-expected guidance for 2025, following a solid prior-year performance.

The research firm maintained its underweight rating on the stock.

Novartis projected mid- to high-single-digit net sales growth for 2025, expecting core operating income to rise in the high single to low double-digit. The guidance came as a surprise to analysts, who had expected moderate single-digit percentage growth due to uncertainties around key drugs losing exclusivity, or LOEs, including heart failure drug Entresto in mid-2025.

"Whilst we do take our numbers up today to land in the FY25 guidance ranges (this drives our PT to CHF 90 from CHF85, which is 11.5x our revised FY25 Core EPS forecast vs. prior 11.1x), we remain closer to the LSD% end of the topline guide vs. the high end. Given our preference this year for catalyst-driven stories, we remain UW," Barclays wrote.

In response to the updated forecast, Barclays adjusted its model to align with Novartis' expectations. The firm raised estimates for Entresto's US performance in the first half of 2025 and lifted full-year estimates for the psoriasis drug Cosentyx and multiple sclerosis treatment Kesimpta.

For 2025, analysts now expect Novartis to generate $51.79 billion in net sales, up from a prior estimate of $51.13 billion, with core EPS forecast raised to $8.51 from $8.35. However, the 2026 outlook remains largely unchanged, with net sales now expected at $51.95 billion versus $51.83 billion previously, and core EPS at $8.79, slightly below the earlier estimate of $8.81.

data.title: Market Chatter: SoftBank, OpenAI to Form Japan Venture
data.description:
OpenAI and SoftBank Group are launching a 50:50 venture to expand AI services in Japan, Bloomberg reported Monday.

The venture intends to hire 1,000 people to market OpenAI's tools to industries from automakers to retailers.

SoftBank expects to generate $3 billion in AI-related sales with the help of OpenAI's tools.

The move underscores SoftBank's AI push, including its $100 billion Stargate project in the US. Founder Masayoshi Son dismissed smaller AI models, saying, "More brain is definitely better."

Japan lags in AI adoption, Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba said at a meeting with Son and OpenAI's Sam Altman.

(Market Chatter news is derived from conversations with market professionals globally. This information is believed to be from reliable sources but may include rumor and speculation. Accuracy is not guaranteed.)

data.title: UBS's Results Look Positive on Several Fronts — Market Talk
data.description: UBS Group's plans to step up share buybacks and a better-than-expected net profit mean its 4Q results look positive on several fronts, RBC Capital Markets' Anke Reingen and Matthew Russell say in a research note. The higher-than-expected net profit was mainly thanks to the Swiss group's investment bank, where revenue was well ahead of consensus expectations, RBC says. Costs came in higher than expected in some divisions, but this could be due to seasonal factors, the analysts say. UBS provided more detailed targets for the turnaround of its U.S. global-wealth-management unit, which is positive, RBC says. On the integration of Credit Suisse, it reiterated its end-2026 savings target but raised its expectations for expenses, RBC says. (adria.calatayud@wsj.com)

data.title: Silver Hovers Near 2-Month Highs
data.description:
Silver traded around $31.5 per ounce on Tuesday, hovering close to its highest since early December as an escalating trade war between the US and China boosted demand for safe-haven assets.

China announced retaliatory tariffs after President Donald Trump’s 10% tariffs on all goods imported from China took effect.

Earlier, Trump agreed to hold off imposing 25% tariffs on Canada and Mexico for a month after the nations agreed to take tougher measures to address migration and drug trafficking.

Meanwhile, strong manufacturing data from the ISM indicated some long-awaited traction for US factory activity, supporting the outlook for silver as an industrial demand, particularly in electrification technologies.

On the supply front, the Silver Institute recently forecasted a fifth consecutive year of significant market deficits for the metal in 2025, driven by strong industrial demand and retail investment.

These factors are expected to outweigh weaker consumption in jewelry and silverware.

data.title: U.S. and China Still Have Time to Strike Deal on Tariffs — Market Talk
data.description: The U.S. and China still have time to strike a deal on tariffs, FOREX.com's David Scutt says in a commentary. While China just unveiled tariffs on select U.S. imports, the deadline for China's tariffs doesn't come until Feb. 10, the market analyst notes. This is keeping USD/CNH movements relatively contained, Scutt says. For now, USD/CNH's swing highs of 7.3680 in September 2023 and 7.3750 in September 2022 remain key levels for traders, he says. "A sustained break above could open the door for an extended run higher, given the price signal it would send," Scutt adds. USD/CNH is 0.1% higher at 7.3181. (ronnie.harui@wsj.com)

data.title: FirstGroup Buys Ireland's Matthews Coach Hire
data.description:
FirstGroup purchased Ireland-based coach and bus operator Matthews Coach Hire for an undisclosed price.

The British transport group said Tuesday that the acquisition, which includes Matthews Coach Hire's freehold depot and vehicles, will bolster its footprint in Ireland and the B2B sector.

data.title: Eurostoxx futures +0.1% in early European trading
data.description:
Key points:
  • German DAX futures -0.1%
  • UK FTSE futures +0.1%

A comforting point for European traders to start their day is that it comes with a breather from Trump stirring up more headlines since it is night time in the US. That said, the hangover from his tariff threats is still something to work through. And for Europe in particular, they might be next in the crosshairs. S&P 500 futures are flat on the day, reflecting a more cautious mood as well with the additional 10% tariffs on China already taking effect and Beijing having launched some counter-tariffs.

data.title: Tokyo Most Actives
Mitsubishi UFJ 9-Mos Total Credit Costs Y251.00 Vs Y263.62B
Mitsubishi UFJ 9-Mos Gains From Earnings of Equity Method Investees Y428.15B Vs Y361.89B
Uncertainty over global tax deal, doesn't work without US, says finance secretary Tuhin Kanta Pandey
data.description:
Union finance secretary Tuhin Kanta Pandey on February 4 said there is a cloud of uncertainty hovering over the global tax deal and it's unlikely to remain functional after President Donald Trump decided to pull out of the agreement.

"US exit has added a lot of uncertainty to global tax deal. It doesn't work without the US," Pandey said during a pot-Budget event organised by Assocham.

After years of stalled negotiations on global tax issues hosted by the Paris based-Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD), a global deal to ensure big companies pay a minimum tax rate of 15 percent was sealed in 2021.

The two-part tax deal aims to end competitive reductions in corporate tax rates around the world and made it harder for highly profitable multinational companies to avoid taxation.

The finance secretary also pointed out that both the government and the Reserve Bank are monitoring the Rupee, which is in a free flow system. He also added that a falling rupee will make exports more competitive.

"Rupee is in a free flow system. Both the government and RBI are monitoring the situation. The falling rupee will also add to export competitiveness. RBI will need to take a call on the level of rupee," he said.Depreciation will pose a risk to inflation, but falling rupee will also add to export competitiveness, Pandey added.

data.title: Garden Reach Shipbuilders & Engineers Clocks Gains in Fiscal Q3 Profit
data.description:
Garden Reach Shipbuilders & Engineers recorded a rise in its profit to 981.8 million Indian rupees in the fiscal third quarter ended Dec. 31, 2024 against 882.5 million rupees a year ago.

Earnings per share climbed to 8.57 rupees compared with a year-ago figure of 7.70 rupees, according to a Monday filing to the the Indian stock exchanges by the shipbuilder.

Revenue from operations in fiscal Q3 also increased to 12.7 billion rupees from 9.23 billion rupees a year earlier.

The company's board also has declared an interim dividend of 8.95 rupees per equity share of face value of 10 rupees each for the financial year 2024-25.

Shares of the company were up nearly 2% in recent trade.

data.title: Wizz Air Posts Higher January Passenger Traffic
data.description:
Wizz Air flew a total of 4,931,319 passengers in January, up from 4,741,820 a year ago.

The budget airline said Tuesday its load factor for the month was 86%, compared with 82% in January 2024.
